author: Special Correspondent
text:
A total of 25,276 women from poor families in the district have received free gold and marriage assistance over the past five years, according to Collector M. Karunakaran.

Distributing gold worth Rs. 2.30 crore and marriage assistance to 794 beneficiaries in a function organised here on Thursday, Dr. Karunakaran said that the scheme, which was being implemented to encourage poor women to go for higher education and help them in getting married, had ensured distribution of Rs. 25,000 assistance and four grams of gold to those who had passed SSLC or Plus Two.

Poor women who had completed degree or diploma programmes were being given Rs. 50,000 and four grams of gold under the scheme.

“In Tirunelveli district, 101.10 kg gold and Rs. 83.08 crore assistance have been given to 25,276 beneficiaries – 7,879 graduate and diploma-holders, and 17,397 girls who have completed SSLC or Plus Two,” Dr. Karunakaran said.

He also informed that 2,700 families had received free cows and 1.12 lakh goats had been given to 28,031 families to improve the living standards of poor rural women. Over 12,000 poor families had received solar-powered green houses, and free mixer grinders, wet grinders and fans had been given to 7.75 lakh families.

Special camps

“Special camps are being conducted by the Department of Animal Husbandry to take care of the cows and goats given to the beneficiaries. Freebies, which are meant for improving the living standards of the downtrodden, especially the rural poor, should be used in a judicious manner to come up in life,” Dr. Karunakaran said.

Chairman of Tamil Nadu Housing Board R. Murugaiah Pandian participated.

25,276 beneficiaries also get Rs. 83.08 crore marriage assistance
title: 101 kg free gold given in Tirunelveli district
